channel.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
channel.description: What is barebone of every rsc private server? What is that like? What methods it MUST contain? Waiting for answers. ;)

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

If I understood you correctly, you’re after the most basic parts for your client to render atleast something? If that is correct, you have to handle logging in, position updating and appearance updating correctly. Then you could handle logging out and walking aswell (it would, after all, be quite boring without the option to atleast walk). Well, from here it just continues, and you’d have to implement more and more for the various features to work, including the core-mechanic (which I infact would say is combat (even if ‘combat’, as a word, is quite vaguely specified)).

Read full topic

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @inTouch inTouch
item.description:
@inTouch wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:7, topic:317298”][quote author=inTouch link=topic=413842.msg3047627#msg3047627 date=1259874960]
I just want to give it a try still, so… I’m still waiting for a useful reply
[/quote]
It’s not a quick, simple, or easy task by any means. Just getting the core done takes hours, even when you know what you’re doing. I have started what you will be attempting to do, and have made some progress, and plan to finish it once I get this other project done. So, I can tell you first hand how big of a task it really is…

P.S. My progress is being tracked on both websites in my signature.[/quote]So what methods are a need for core?

Read full topic

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

lets take a 562 rsps for example, like the one im making completely out of scratch

  1. really annoying because u have to go though so much time for the javac to find its path though it can be easy to some people, im sorta new to it.

  2. fun and time consuming (except for coding -.-)…

  3. u have to bug some rsps communties for help and codes

  4. can be very lonely if u do it alone and barely know what you’re doing (me)

  5. its very hard to make the commands work on 562 servers

  6. really hard to make urself the owner.

  7. u have to code this, code that, copy, paste, save, compile, repeat.

  8. Java files are scattered in any folder, like for example the player.java files can be in rs2HD while npc’s.java can be in pali -.-

  9. u get fed up of when the compiler says “error” and u have to go through the pain of finding what u made and deleting it.

  10. very well worth it, once ur work is finished, u feel great and accomplished of ur work

Read full topic

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

inTouch:

I just want to give it a try still, so… I’m still waiting for a useful reply

It’s not a quick, simple, or easy task by any means. Just getting the core done takes hours, even when you know what you’re doing. I have started what you will be attempting to do, and have made some progress, and plan to finish it once I get this other project done. So, I can tell you first hand how big of a task it really is…

P.S. My progress is being tracked on both websites in my signature.

Read full topic

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @whetstoa whetstoa
item.description:
@whetstoa wrote:

No offence inTouch, but if your waiting for somone to give you a step by step tutorial on how to start from scratch, thats probley not going to happen. Seeing as how your replying to the posts, i’m going to assume you know hardly anything about java or MYSQL. Try using the “Search” Feature to look for some tutorials.

Reading is learning… Its like asking your mom for a brand new car… She tells you to get off your lazy ass and get a job and buy 1 yourself. Same in this case… Read and learn, and build your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?

item.description:

I want to start my own source from scratch. So where do I need to start from? What should the server’s barebone contain so I could run it successfully for the first time? (to also read data from mysql tables).

item.title: Making rsc server from scratch?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

You can download RSCD, and remove all the features, like all the handlers, events, ect if you want…

And you don’t “need” any methods, except for a main or run…

Read full topic
